Posts.Content: Sarnie123 wrote: Hi my first time: Just had my yearly check up with my breast consultant, as I am suffering with pain in my right breast after a lumpectomy etc four years ago now, he has suggested lipofilling the effected breast and said this may probably help with the pain, as I have little fat there at the moment.  Also, he has offered a small breast reduction in my healthy breast. Can anyone give me their opinions in both of these procedures - do they work .... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Lipofilling Sarnie123 Sarnie123

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2010 01:47PM Sarnie123 wrote: Hi - I had IDC stage III and had a lumpectomy and they took four nodes out at the same time, the sentinal node showed cancer so a week later they  took the rest out of my right arm under a general, I thought they put the dye through once I was asleep. I must say that both operations were better than expected, not that painful at all - that was 4 years ago and I think the way they do things are improving all the time. So please don't worry, write down your questions and ask them, at the time I really didn't know what was going on I just wanted the cancer taken out - have you got a breast care nurse you can phone - mine did help me a lot.  take care Sarniexx
